C2 not giving you an advantage or a good chance of success: Current conditions are very unfavourable for new businesses. We have to be prepared for an unfavourable outcome.
C2 negative and showing that you do not like something: He always talks about her in an unfavourable way. Of those surveyed, 62 percent said they had an unfavourable opinion of the president. The film has had unfavourable reviews. Synonyms
